com.yantra.api.ydm

Interface unpackShipment

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YDMApi, YIFApi

    public interface unpackShipment

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document unpackShipment(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      unpackShipment is used to unpack containers in a shipment.

    • Method Detail

      • unpackShipment

        org.w3c.dom.Document unpackShipment(YFSEnvironment env,
                                    org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                             throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                    java.rmi.RemoteException

        unpackShipment is used to unpack containers in a shipment. This operation does the complementary operation of pack. All operations carried out during pack will be undone. Unpack shipment unpacks only those containers in the shipment that are specified in the Containers element that constitutes the input to this API.

        Unpacking does not result in change of shipment status. Therefore unpack is not a pipeline transaction. However, the shipment_containerized_flag in YFS_SHIPMENT is updated as follows:

        • 01 - packing has not begun
        • 02 - packing in progress
        Valid shipment status range for the unpack operation is governed by the status modification rules for modification_type SHIPMENT_UNPACK and modification_level SHIPMENT.

        The processing logic of the API is as follows:
        1. Carry out input validations as detailed within the Validations section.
        2. For each container in the input XML:
          1. Delete shipment container (YFS_SHIPMENT_CONTAINER).
          2. Delete container instructions (YFS_INSTRUCTION_DETAIL), delete special services reference(YFS_SPECIAL_SERVICE_REF) and delete container additional attributes (YFS_ADDITIONAL_ATTRIBUTES).
          3. Delete container details instructions (YFS_CONTAINER_DETAILS), delete ShipmentTagSerials(YFS_SHIPMENT_TAG_SERIAL) for every containerdetail
          4. If the container is a parent container for other containers, blank out the parent container no from all the child containers.
          5. If the carrier on the shipment requires carrier integration either for domestic or international shipments, perform calls to the carrier server to undo the packing operation.
        3. Update the total freight charges on the shipment to exclude the freight charges of the containers being unpacked.
        4. Set shipment's containerized status to one of the following:
          • 01 - completely unpacked
          • 02 - unpacking in progress (if there is at least one container associated with the shipment)
        5. If the shipment is completely unpacked, blank out YFS_SHIPMENT.manifest_key.

          Note: Although the XML input to the API specifies ZeroOrMany Container, the API processes only one Container. If passed, other containers will be ignored. ZeroOrMany is reserved for future use.

        Validations:
        • One of ShipmentKey or ShipmentNo, ShipNode and SellerOrganizationCode must be passed. This should point to a valid shipment.
        • The shipment status must be one of the statuses defined for the shipment modification rules for the modification type SHIPMENT_UNPACK, unless OverrideModificationRules is set to Y, in which status check will not be carried out. Shipment should not be closed.
        • /Shipment/Containers/Container: A unique container is identified by <Shipment Key (or ShipmentNo) and Container No> OR <ShipmentContainerKey>. If the data passed in the Container element does not point to a valid container, an error is thrown (YDM00072). Therefore, in the Container element one of ContainerNo or ShipmentContainerKey must be passed.


        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised:
        Raised during the transaction YDM_UNPACK_SHIPMENT.

          ON_SUCCESS:
            This event is raised upon successful execution of packShipment.
            Data published - YDM_UNPACK_SHIPMENT.ON_SUCCESS.xml
            DTD - YDM_UNPACK_SHIPMENT.ON_SUCCESS_dtd.txt
            Key Data - shipment_dbd.txt

              Template Support: Yes
              However, note that the template name reads <Transaction ID>.ON_SUCCESS.xml.

        Audits: None

        Pre Conditions: None

        Post Conditions:
        Shipment lines are returned to the uncontainerized state and shipment containerization state is updated appropriately (as detailed above).

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains all the information about the container. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
